text:
News Releases

Payroll employment increases by 263,000 in September; unemployment rate edges down to 3.5% Total nonfarm payroll employment increased by 263,000 in September, and the unemployment rate edged down to 3.5 percent. Notable job gains occurred in leisure and hospitality and in health care.

| | | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees increase 0.2% in August Real average hourly earnings for all employees increased 0.2 percent in August, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.3 percent, and CPI-U increased 0.1 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.1 percent.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for October 2022 is scheduled to be released on November 4, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for September 2022 is scheduled to be released on October 13, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: CES (National) : U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics

meta_data.description: Employment, Hours, and Earnings from the Current Employment Statistics survey (National) Home Page
